dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An infinity of space. In the distance a cluster of in- distinguishable shapes moves TOWARDS US. As they CLOSE TO CAMERA, we SEE they are a pack of wild mustangs -- a stallion and nine mares running hard. They race PAST CAMERA in a thundering blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tight cluster of horses thunders into the home stretch. In a sudden burst of speed, Number "7,"" a big bay with black mane and tail, pulls away and moves up on the out- side. The crowd goes wild!

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rising Star in his last race before retirement. The most spectacular stallion in the history of the turf! -- Triple Crown Winner -- With over 3.1/2 million in purses -- At the finish it's Rising Star by a nose.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (continuing) He's done itl -- this marks his twenty-seventh win ~- and what- a-way-to-goll!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bull at the top of his arc, all four feet off the gound, The rider is SONNY STEELE, looking as if he were welded to the bull's back. BUZZER SOUNDS the end of a perfect ride, but as the fans jump to their feet, Sonny continues his ride just-for-the-hell-of-it!! Then he vaults off the beast landing on the balls of his feet, with both arms raised triumphantly as the crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER CHAMPIONSHIP BELT BUCKLE 3
dialogues.text: ZOOM BACK as the wearer, Sonny, charges his horse from the chute, rides down on a running steer. CROWD SOUND CARRIES OVER. Sonny drops expertly onto the horns and pins the steer to the ground,

dialogues.speaker: SPINNING RED LIGHT ATOP AN AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO SEE the ambulance just off a rodeo arena. Two cowboys carry the limp body of Sonny towards it. As the cowboys are about to put him in, he comes to, squirms out of their grasp, shekes his head to clear it, and limps back toward the arena. CHEERING CONTINUES .

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER RODEO ARENA
dialogues.text: Sonny atop a spinning, bucking saddle bronc. PUSH IN until the spinning becomes a blur. SOUNDTRACK BEGINS TO FADE SLOWLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny, center stage, surrounded by well-wishers, is handed another championship buckle. Smiling, he looks from the new one to the one he is already wearing, then - tosses the buckle affectionately to a pretty blonde gir in the crowd. She catches it and holds it up with still a third silver buckle. COLOR FADES SLOWLY from the pieture and the SOUNDTRACK is now ONLY AN ECHO.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Picture is almost BLACK AND WHITE and there is NO SOUND. The deadly ballet goes on in eerie silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny lies on a medical table. Two doctors stitch up his back. His hand dangles over the side of the table clutching a can of Coors beer. Two cowboy faces are visible through the glass door in b.g. The picture be- gins to FLICKER and MOVE MORE SLOWLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny receives still another silver belt buckle, Film slows further and moves forward jerkily. From the si- lence comes a NEW SOUND: the CLICKING OF SPROCKETS. A champagne cork silently pops and as the liquid sprays over the frame, Sonny smiles a devastating smile. FRAME FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: VOLCE
dialogues.text: That's it! PULL BACK QUICKLY TO SEE we have been looking at a moviola, which has stopped on the last frame. The opera-~ tor's hand is visible holding the brake.  10

dialogues.text: CAMERA TRAVELS PAST the back of four designers, all at work painting various versions of Sonny Steele smiling. PUSH IN on last drawing, the closest approximation of the Sonny we saw in the freeze frame; the same dazzling smile, his eyes full of life and mischief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on a sleeping cowboy. Sonny. His Stetson pulled down ‘against the harsh fluorescent lights. A little boy stands nearby, staring at his boots. Sonny's head rises slowly, he clucks softly as though to a horse. The boy smiles. LEROY, Sonny's assistant and dresser, moves INTO SHOT and helps him to his feet, propping him up.

dialogues.speaker: LEROY
dialogues.text: Come on, Champ -- we gotta do Santa Paula. We FOLLOW FROM BEHIND, as WENDELL, Sonny's manager abpear and takes his other side. Wendell is in his fifties, still hard-bodied with wind-leathered skin and pale eyes that take in more than they give out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Looks like Floyd Gerber has had it for the night. And that means that Lester Crosley of Santa Rosa has won the Demolition Derby! More APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (continuing) And now folks, while we get ready for the next race, we've got a special treat for you... Behind the AMPCO MAN, the dressing room door opens and Wendell and Leroy manhandle the vag-doll figure of Sonny out the door.

dialogues.text: We HEAR SOUNDS OF THE GAME, as Sonny roars up in his white Cadillac. He gets out, starts toward his trailor when he sees the AMPCO Man coming toward him. Sonny sneaks a look at his watch, but for once the AMPCO Man doesn't look annoyed. looks smug.

dialogues.speaker: A BANK OF ELEVATORS 30
dialogues.text: Cases of camrea equipment are being put on one elevator. They are stenciled W.B.C, DIGEST. When the cameraman, BERNIE, is satisfied that they are safe, he moves to join his group at the other elevator. Among his group is his assistant, ERIC, and HALLIE MARTIN, thirties, chic, urban and at the moment very bored. They are attended by FITZ- -GERALD, the AMPCO PR Chief.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: What time is the press conference? Hallie shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got half an hour. Elevator arrives. We FOLLOW them in.

dialogues.speaker: INT ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Hallie leans her head back against the corner, eyes half- closed.

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD
dialogues.text: I'm sure you'll love your rooms, the place is yours, we've got half a dozen Movie people, Bug Broderick just came in with Joanna Camden, Rising Star's here. We got the biggest damn Earth Mover you ever saw...a helluva show planned for tonight and --

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: What're you doing with the horse? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD
dialogues.text: He'll be onstage with Sonny STeele, | you know, the cowboy we use for Ranch Breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: (to Hallie) Worth covering?

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD
dialogues.text: (nervously) Well...there's better stuff. The cowboy's a peach of a guy -- but not terriffic copy. Lot's of "yup" and "shucks’. . Hallie's eyes open slightly.

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD
dialogues.text: (continuinr) He's no interviyw --I'd steer clear.

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me, has Mr. Sonny Steele checked in yet?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (referring to notes) I don't have him listed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on a small tape recorder. A finger presses "START." Two drinks are set down beside it and CAMERA PULLS BACK to REVEAL a nervous Wendell in conversation with Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: That's a very unusual watchband.

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am, it’s Indian.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: May I see it? Wendell takes off his watch, hands it to her, all the while trying to keep an eye on the door for Sonny. Hallie puts the watch on.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's lovely. - (hands it back) Listen... why would AMPCO ask us not to interview Sonny Steele?

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Where'd you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: One of your AMPCO people.

dialogues.speaker: . WENDELL
dialogues.text: Well... that don't mean anything. They're just a little down on Sonny right now... he ain't been actin’ himself lately. He's a cowboy...- sometimes he loses the best part of himself.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What's the best part of himself? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Oh, you'd have to know him a long time to know that.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: How long have you known him?

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Long, long time... 'fore his daddy died. Came up to my knee. CAMERA HAS PULLED AWAY, and now PANS all the activity in the casino -- displays, celebrities, and always the flashbulbs. :

dialogues.speaker: LONG VIEW
dialogues.text: The sun is a bloody yolk melting into the mountain tops. MUSIC UP. HOLD, then:

dialogues.speaker: A GLOVED ELECTRICIAN'S HAND
dialogues.text: He throws a large toggle switch. FULL SHOT - A SIGN : . It lights into life. Animated! A giant smiling cow- boy, with a moving arm... hitchhiking. Thousands of blinking lights.

dialogues.speaker: A CLOCK TO ANOTHER ELECTRICAL SWITCH
dialogues.text: Another hand throws this switch.

dialogues.speaker: A SECTION OF "THE STRIP" -
dialogues.text: Three more signs leap into life. Moving, blinking, silently shouting for attention.

dialogues.speaker: STILL ANOTHER SWITCH
dialogues.text: Sparks fly as this one is slammed home.

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE LAS VEGAS STRIP
dialogues.text: In full dress. A hundred million kilowatts, moving, gyrating, spinning, expanding. ‘ (CONTINUED) 34 35 36 37 38 39 40  4 42 43 17.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Through the center of this electric jungle, Sonny's white cadillac appears, threading it's way thzoughk the traffic As it PASSES CAMERA, HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: EXT CAESAR'S PALACE
dialogues.text: He's driven hard and he and the car show it. He starts towards the entrance, but notices Rising Star's corrall He moves to it, takes of his sunglasses and stares at the animal through red-rimmed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Sonny!! . He rushes up, grabs Sonny by the arm and drags him toward the entranceway.

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Dammit, where you been?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (looking back;} Hooo...he's slick. (then) What's...what's he doin' in the parking lot?

dialogues.speaker: BENDELL

" That's what you'll do anyway, tell it : the way you want to tell it. You don't need me to tell you a story! You guys make 'em up all the time anyway! (then) Ask me questions about why I'm 45 minutes late -~ you're not interested in why I'm late, all you're interested. in is gettin' a rise out 'a me! ‘Pound for pound, who's worth more, you or the horse?’ Who the hell cares? You people are all the same. (suddenly) “ You know there's people in Africa or some damm place, you take a picture ' of "em, they'll kill you. They think you're takin’ somethin' away from ‘em. That you only got so much... stuff!,.. and if other people are takin' it all, then there ain't none left for yourself. Well, I don't want to be no story. (then) . I just retired from Public Life. . HALLIE ‘ Boy have you got it wrong! You just rode down the Las Vegas Strip on somebody else's 12 million dollar horse, Did you think we wouldn't notice? You're a story all right. He has packed the camping things and now pours the re- maining coffee onto the fire, putting it out. It hisses in the moonlight.

(he keeps walking) Come on, do a working girl a favor -- I'm trying to make an honest buck. Tell an honest tale, make an.honest dollar, I don't want to make up a story about you, (he keeps walking) What's the big secret? What've you got to lose? Everybody wants to know. They wonder where you are, why you did it -- where you're going. The truth about the Great. American Cowboy and the world's champion horse who disappear into the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sonny glances back quickly, then concentrates on what is ahead. A split second before the horse reaches the edge, Sonny pulls hard on the reins. Rising Star digs in with all four legs and skids forward. They slide over the top and down the embankment, the horse re- maining stiff-legged through the loose shale to the bottom. The first motorcycle, unable to stop, cata- pults over the edge and tumbles over and over to the bottom. The cop, thrown clear, manages to get up, dirty but unhurt. The police car turns and runs parallel to Sonny at the top of the embankment, trailed by the two remaining motorcycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The valley Sonny is in levels out in front of him. The hill on his left flattens down to his level. The police ear, running parallel, is gradually coming down to his level. Sonny slows the horse slightly, causing the police car to do the same. At the last minute, Sonny lets the horse out, and barely edges out the police car. But from around the hill on Sonny's right, a second police car flies out. Unable to turn in time, it hits the first car broadside. The two cars slide to the left up another embankment. :

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: --seeing this country as if for the first time. Not looking down from a jet 30 thousand feet above, but from --

dialogues.speaker: DAY CAMPSITE
dialogues.text: “He takes the bandage off the tendon, throws it away. Hallie is talking into her tape recorder (CONTINUING

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) --the low angle of a man who means to cross it on foot...leading a thoroughbred stallion to a secret destination, to a private goal...to a ‘rightness'...a ‘fairness’ he hopes to find in these valleys. Valleys sheltered beneath snow capped mountains, that meet the sky in an.eternal geometry of silence. For this observer-it's like being at sea in the vastness of America. She turns off the tape recorder. He moves toward her. She whips the-recorder protectively behind her back. HALLIE © (continuing) Oh no you don't.... (then plaintively) You're not going to throw it away, are you? He looks at her a moment, then bends down and kisses her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: That was nice about the mountains and the valleys. He moves away, and we HOLD on Hallie. She's touched, and strangely embarrassed, so;

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Hype. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SONY
dialogues.text: Fooled me, He moves the horse into pasition for her to mount.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I think I'd like to walk... like you. He smiles, nods, starts off in his rolling eccentric gait. She falls in beside him, in an EXACT PARODY of Sonny's walk. He bursts out laughing, puts his arm around her shoulder. As they move away; MUSIC UP. Begin PART ILI MONTAGE

dialogues.speaker: A ROCKY HILL
dialogues.text: They are coming down now. Rising Star travels the hill with something approaching expertise. When he reaches bottom, Hallie is almost as proud as Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: A RIDGELINE
dialogues.text: MUSIC FADES as Sonny looks over the edge ‘of the ridge, reacts.

dialogues.speaker: ROAD AND GAS STATION BELOW 226
dialogues.text: In the middle of nowhere, just off the blacktop.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SONNY
dialogues.text: Sonny is disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: That ain't supposed to be there, . or we ain't supposed to be here.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (ineredulous) You're lost?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Bout a miles' worth, looks like. Better get off this ridge. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 227 Revised Feb.5 123, CONTINUED: / 227. As they move away from the ridge, they approach a steep embankment. Sonny leads Rising Star down carefully. Hallie starts to follow, catches her heel and tumbles the entire way down to the bottom. Sonny hurries to her as she tries te get up.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: You allright?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Tip top, thanks. But as she tries to stand, she winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Sure?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Really... really, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: You better sit. down.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (rubbing her butt) You don't seem to understand the problem.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Well, lay down or something.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: And listen to you bitch about my boots?... not on your life. She starts to hobble, gamely.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: We're making damn good time. Now relax: She stretches out on her side, favoring the injured side. Sonny fishes in the green bag and takes out a mason jar of bourbon that the Pocmer left. He brings it to Hallie, who takes a sip. Then Sonny takes a long drink.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: You rest. I'm gonna find us a place to cross that road. [I won't be long. He moves off as she watches.  Revised Feb. 3 £24,

dialogues.speaker: EXT AMPCO TOWER
dialogues.text: Establishing the huge building.

dialogues.speaker: INT AMPCO EXECUTIVE SUITE
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on a map of UTAH, spread out on a desk. PULL BACK to see ALL AMPCO exec’s present.

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD
dialogues.text: . talk about boondocks -

dialogues.speaker: TOLAND
dialogues.text: She ordered a camera crew to meet her there. I suppose to photo- graph the, uh --

dialogues.speaker: SEARS
dialogues.text: ‘Ceremony’. An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: SEARS
dialogues.text: The sales figures again. Exactly. As Toland rifles through his notes, THE DOOR OPENS IN THE B.G. and a BUS BOY from the caterer comes in and begins quietly cleaning up a table of food.

dialogues.speaker: TOLAND
dialogues.text: Cumulatively up thirty percent - By closing time in the east, they'd emptied the shelves. Sears’ attention has shifted to the Bus Boy.

dialogues.speaker: SEARS
dialogues.text: (calling to him) Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: BUS BOY
dialogues.text: Sir? |

dialogues.speaker: SEARS
dialogues.text: Your shirt! And now WE SEE that under his windbreaker he is wearing a T-shirt emblazoned with Sonny's Face.

dialogues.speaker: BUS BOY
dialogues.text: From one of those guys sellin’ ‘em on the street. Feature Sears' reaction.

dialogues.speaker: SEARS
dialogues.text: Thank you.  are ee ~~ ow ee 230 231 232 Revised Feb. 5 : LZ.

dialogues.speaker: EXT GAS STATION
dialogues.text: Hallie is approaching the store very carefully. She looks in the window before she goes to the entrance. She has her sunglasses on.

dialogues.speaker: INT GAS STATION/STORE
dialogues.text: It is tended by a LITTLE GIRL, apparently alone. There are candy bars, beef jerky, some novelties. Otherwise it is barren.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Hi. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Louise.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Same as mine. You run this place yourself, Louise?

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: Your name really Louise?

dialogues.speaker: RALLIE
dialogues.text: You bet. Your mother or father around?

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: My mom went to get Butane. We're out.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Do you have a telephone?

dialogues.speaker: LOUTSE
dialogues.text: Out, too. Every time it snows up at Marysvale, first thing the phone goes out... Where's your car?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sort of camping out, and the car's on the fritz, and I wanted to let my boss know, and uh... will you be going anywhere near a phone? I mean, later, like when you close up?

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: We got a phone at home. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee 232

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She takes Revised Feb. 5 126. 232

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I'll bet you could make a call for me and deliver the message. What do you charge to make a call?

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: One dollar.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: That's fair. out a pen and paper from her bag. Writing:

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Here's the number... and you ask for Mr. Les Charles and you don't talk to anybody else, no secretary or anything, and when you get him on the phone, you tell him that you're calling f'r me...

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: - For Louise.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No... yes, for Louise in Utah.

dialogues.speaker: ' LOUISE
dialogues.text: I know what state it is.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: And Louise says to please call off the crew, and to, ch, to call off everything and thac I'll explain when I see him. Outside, a pick-up pulls into the station, stops.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: I better tell him how your car's broken down. Two roadworkers get out of the truck, start for the door.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No! Just the other part.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: About the flu?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No, the crew! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised Feb. 5 127.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The men enter.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) I have an idea. I'1l write out the whole message and then you can just read it to him. As she scribbles the message, Louise adresses the men;

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: Her car broke down.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Where's that, Miss?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: It didn't actually break down. It's just the way it acts.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: I have to call her boss from home cause the phone's out here.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: We could give you a lift into...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No, no thank you...

dialogues.speaker: MAN /
dialogues.text: . Or make that call for you?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You know, Louise, this is all too complicated. I think “ tc ic. should just a cf tho love a couple o those candy bars... and these. She grabs a few things, slaps a five dollar bill on the counter and rushes out. 233° EXT A ROCKY AREA - SONNY - LATE DAY 233 Trudging back toward where he left Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: EXT THE RIDGELINE
dialogues.text: She scrambles hurriedly up the hill.  235 236 Revised Feb. 5 128.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Closer to the camp. He stops abruptly, as we HEAR the distant wail of a police siren.

dialogues.speaker: EXT THE CAMP
dialogues.text: She rushes in, relieved that he is not there yet. She starts to take the purchases out of her bag, hears a noise, quickly puts the things back into her bag and turns just in time to see Sonny appear over a rise. He smiles at her, moves to put the gear onto Rising Star.

dialogues.speaker: . SONNY
dialogues.text: How ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Good as new.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: We can cross about a mile down. Better honk on it. I wanta get where we're goin’ fore dark.

dialogues.speaker: / HALLIE
dialogues.text: (alarmed) We're that.close??

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: To where we're spendin’ the nighc. Inside. for a change. Place I know belonged to a crazy old rodeo an- nouncer. Clark Wembly... if it's still stnadin'. Hallie is worried now, trying desperately to stall.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Isn't there some,,, some closer place where you guys take horses to let them go. Sonny looks at her a moment, continues to work,

dialogues.speaker: . SONNY
dialogues.text: No, I just use the one, myself...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You know, this place is so pretty. If I were Rising Star, I'd be perfectly happy to -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revised Feb. 5 129.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (his back to her) Hey, do me a favor Alice, don't go tryin to think like a horse. TIGHTEN TO a worried Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: EXT UTAH AIRPORT
dialogues.text: The AMPCO JET touches down and WHOOSHES past CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: EXT UTAH AIRPORT
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO SEE him near the plane addressing a group of reporters. He is dressed in western gear. Toland stands near him.

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD
dialogues.text: . although one network or report- er may think he or she deserves a monopoly on the news, we at AMPCO believe that the public's right to know supercedes every other consi- deration. That's why we've called you here, it's good citizenship and good business. During above PAN TOLAND through the reporters to a waiting limo flanked by two police cars.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Where exactly are we going?

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD'S VOLCE
dialogues.text: T£ you'll just be patient and follow our instructions -- Toland enters the limo, revealing Sears and Dietrich. 239 EXT - A CABIN IN THE MOUNTAINS - NIGHT . 23° CAMERA PANS past rocks in the moonlight, comes to rest on Rising Star, blanketed outside the decrepit cabin.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: . had this place built his first successful year. Should of heard him over the P.A. Voice like sticky molasses; “And Sonny Steele did hi eight!  240 130.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: A fire burms in the crumbling fireplace. Old rodeo posters peel off the walls. Sonny is expansive, talk- ative, Hallie is very subdued.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (laughs) Damn! You know anybody in the whole world their life's just all what happens in eight seconds? Just waitin' for the buzzer... boy am I rumnin' off at the mouth. Hallie sits.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Yes, you are. | (then) I enjoyed it.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Well... you're polite.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: When do we get there?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: "Bout midday. (then) Somethin’ botherin' you?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No. What happens to you... after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna’ start the questions again? She smiles, but persists.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What happens when he's loose and chasing mares? Do you just de the same?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (Levelly) I don't know. He moves to her, kneels level with her eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (continuing) What do you think should happen? You're a... clever lady, you got all the facts. How you gonna end your story? She wants desperately to tell him. Can't.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You say it like it's a bad word, ‘clever'. Would you rather I were dumb?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: I like you bein' smart. But sometimes you get so busy bein' clever that... well, when was the last time you was surprised?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (quietly) You. You were a surprise Sonny. They look at each other. He moves slowly foreward to kiss her. She turns her face abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (barely audible): I told them. They are both frozen for a moment. Hallie continues guick

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I called the network and told them where you were going. {eyes closed) I told them to meet me there with a camera crew. They're probably there now. Sonny nods imperceptably, waits.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: That's... not all.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Oh? Now for the bad news, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I lied to you about my going to jail. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (2)
dialogues.text: Sonny exhales slowly, rises, moves around the room.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well... yell at me, or slap me, or something...

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: I already slapped you, Alice, first time we was alone to- gether. You want me to use a club?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have done it now, Sonny, I swear...

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Sure you would. You're a reporter. A damn good one. You'd... report.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) God, this is ridiculous! You're the one that broke the law and I feel like the criminal‘

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (nodding) Why d'you think that is?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Because I didn't expect to get . involved.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Involved. Y'mean it's OK to mess life up for strangers?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I didn't want to mess anything up. I wanted to get the story. ALL of it.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: You got that allright. Hell IT called you and gave you a story. Wasn't enough, was it? Where's my letter? You mail it or is that goin’ on TV too? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “SONNY (sharply) You got no right tryin’ to get yourself promoted on the TV with my troubles. It’s nobody's business!

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Sonny, you're public domain. And you asked for it. Nobody held a gun to your head to make you sign with AMPCO. That is your picture up there on the box, isn't it? In focus - so you must've sat still. It's not your back running away. It's that big... sweet... bewildered smile.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: The horse didn't sign nuthin! And he sure as hell wasn’t smilin'.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I see, this was all for the horse?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: No. This was supposed to be for both of us. We don't do that work no more.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (compassionately) Sonny... you can't resign from being famous.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Wanta bet? ‘ Silence for a long moment. Then;

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: What I said.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: But you can't: They'll be there ++. and maybe the police:

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: I gotta face ‘em sooner or later. T ain't gonna run for ever. (then) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Did what y'had to do, Alice. Y'ean't change it now.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (miserable) I just wanted to do my job, Sonny. Be the best at it. The way you did in rodeo.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: That's fair.
240 She moves slowly to him. lLeans her head on his shoulder without touching him.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: It's past your bedtime, Alice. We got an interesting day, tomorrow. She holds his face, kisses him. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: LONG VIEW
dialogues.text: The image holds for only an instant. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Their kiss, from another angle. Closer. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: LONG VIEW
dialogues.text: The image holds slightly longer. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT CABIN
dialogues.text: On the sleeping bag, holding each other. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE MOUNTAIN MEADOW
dialogues.text: Idyllic, sun-drenched, green.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S VOICE OVER
dialogues.text: Are we almost there?

dialogues.speaker: INT CABIN
dialogues.text: Touching each other. SOUND OF THE WIND OUTSIDE. 241 242

dialogues.speaker: THE MEADOW AND STREAM
dialogues.text: Sonny is umsaddling Rising Star.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (simply) We are there. Hallie looks around frantically. There is the FAR OFF WHINNIE of mustangs. Rising Star dances nervously.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: But... wait a minute: The Camera Crew... they're not here! Sonny begins to take the horseshoes off Rising Star.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: ‘Pears not. (to the horse) Well, Star, what d'you think of the place?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: They must be at another entrance.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Ain't no other entrance.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Then hurry! They're late, or they got lost:

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well where the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Probably at Rim Rock Canyon. That's where you told ‘em to go, ain't it? It's bout 90 miles north a here.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You mean this isn't ..... 222

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: This here's Silver Reef. Pretty isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (dumbs truck) Why you lying.... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED 247
dialogues.text: She starts to beat on him, laughing hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: LONG VIEW
dialogues.text: She pounding on him, the two of them laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I never told you I was going to no Rim Rock Canyon. Heil it's buried in snow.

dialogues.speaker: EXT RIM ROCK CANYON
dialogues.text: And it is buried in snow. START ON a freezing Fitzgerald, PAN to a Miserable DIETRICH and then on to a surreal mess Towers erected to hold camera's. A mobile unit parked nearby. Portable heaters surrounded by freezing reporters A LARGE BANNER flaps in the wind reading: WELCOME SONNY STEELE, GOOD LUCK RISING STAR FROM THE AMPCO Ci . toland trudges through the snow to the Limo, the window's of which are frosted ftom the heater inside.

dialogues.speaker: INT LIMO
dialogues.text: Toland enters. Sears stares off into space.

dialogues.speaker: TOLAND
dialogues.text: I don't think there's enough food for another night. (beat) I... don't think he's coming.

dialogues.speaker: SEARS
dialogues.text: It's occured to me. TOLAND ’ Try to prosecute again?

dialogues.speaker: SEARS
dialogues.text: We can't turn around now. (pause) Write him off. The Lone Ranger and Silver. May they rot in... (shakes his head) We probably couldn't buy the publicity.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEADOW
dialogues.text: They've walked a distance since we left them. Sonny removes the horse's last shoe.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: He's calmed down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Until the breeze shifts again.

dialogues.speaker: LONG VIEW
dialogues.text: Running, moving, smelling Rising Star.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SONNY, HALLIE
dialogues.text: The horse throws his head back, rears. Sonny calms him. Hallie moves close to the horse, touches his head. -

dialogues.speaker: . HALLIE
dialogues.text: We don't go back too far but... good luck! Never mind you had” a priveleged upbringing, you're a star! You swing your tail, now. Sonny smiles, takes Star's reins.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Excuse us a minute. 1 He walks the horse a distance away. Takes the bit out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Remember, they're just horses, same as you, only they never been broke. But they never won no championships neither. So when you cross that stallion and he wants to fight, remember you got the blood on your side.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (calling out) Will he go - just like that?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: But I thought you guys were pals.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: We are. (chen) Go get ‘em, Junkie. And he swats the horse hard, on the flanks. Rising Star turns, and gallops away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Make somethin’ out ‘a yourself, now...

dialogues.speaker: A LONG VIEW
dialogues.text: They stand very still as Rising Star races free toward the running mustangs. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT A SMALL CAFE
dialogues.text: A young boy is washing the window outside the table where Sonny and Hallie sit. They've finished eating.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Good. Maybe not as good as him... but good.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: (checks her watch) The Limo should be here soon.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: I remember Lime's.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Paris next. {she smiles) Should be quite a change. The elections. There’s going to be a new ) premier. A waitress arrives with a jelly donut with a tiny candle stuck in it. Hallie is very touched.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: For Bon Voyage, I figured. She blows out the candle. Silence. ” SONNY More coffee?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No thanks, I shouldn't drink too much coffee because it... (she trails off) . God I'd love to see you in Paris. See Paris with you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: You're flirting.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Maybe. Sonny points to a spot on the window that the kid missed. The kid mouths his thanks. Silence. They both

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Just... don't feel right. Paris.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: What feels right?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Moovin' on... somethin' simple . hard maybe but plain. Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: No... company, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Maybe for awhile. SONNY ° (gently) I don't see you in a trailor Alice, makin' sure there's enough cold beer.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I can find where the quarter goes in the laundromat.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: You'd run out of me in a month's time. kmow it's true. She looks out the window. HALLIE . I wonder where Star'll be tonight. I hope she's good enough for him. Outside the Big Black Limo pulls up. Sonny starts to rise (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Don't get up... please. She stands, puts her coat on. She bends She moves

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You know, there's a lot more to New York than Bloomingbergs' or those 'Madison Square Gardens’. It's a wonderful city, honest. Have you ever seen it - I mean ‘ really seen it?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Like from the top?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: There are worse places. (then) Still got my card?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Still got it. over, kisses him softly on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: So long, Norman. SONNY e So long, Alice. quickly away, we see her enter the limo through the window. She looks out, waves a tiny wave. Sonny waves back.

dialogues.speaker: LEROY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Hell y'suppose he's doin’ now?

dialogues.speaker: EXT GREYHOUND BUS
dialogues.text: It approaches, then passes camera.

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Sonny'll be allright. Lord'1ll take care ‘a Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: LEROY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Yeah. But why?

dialogues.speaker: INT GREYHOUND BUS
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On the last seat. The bus is dark, the other passengers asleep. They pass a can of beer in a sack.

dialogues.speaker: LEROY
dialogues.text: Lemme see that letter.

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Threw it away.

dialogues.speaker: LEROY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: (recites) "Dear Wendell and Leroy; OK I done it now. I hope you ain't too mad at me. [ did what [ had to do. With love and affec- tion I remain --"

dialogues.speaker: LEROY
dialogues.text: "He" remains! What do we remain?

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Sonny done us a favor, Lee. Been ‘so long since we talked about now. ng of us. "Did, did, was, was, (0 rode ‘“Twinkles' and who throwed 'Bubbles!, remember this, remember that."

dialogues.speaker: LEROY
dialogues.text: Yeah, he sure brought us up to date now, allright! Back to Leo Marston's ranch. Probably still runs it like a damm con- centration camp!

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Look ‘a that moon. Leroy puts his magazine away. . LEROY . How come... everybody always paid so much attention to Sonny?

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: (shrugs) He's jusc... one 'a them guys people like to pay attention to. (sips his beer) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WENDELL
dialogues.text: Princes and fools, Lee. Watchers and dooers. Leroy is thinking. Wendell turns back to the window, to the night outside, begins to HUM SOFTLY.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: It, plunges through the night.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: ... all charges have been dropped and according to one company source the AMPCO art department is hard at work designing a new logo.

dialogues.speaker: INT A TV STUDIO
dialogues.text: She is at a news desk. Her co-anchor is on her right. Two cameras cover the Live broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: As to the whereabouts of Rising Star... (she pauses) - Nothing further is known. She begins to collect her papers.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: So ends the bizarre saga of horse- racings’ most honored stallion. And the unusual man who sect him free. (then) Except for a minor postscript. The co-anchor man looks over abruptly. The camera man covering her checks the clock and is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: Mr. Steele will be happy to hear that his name is not as well known as it was - even a week ago. Signs fade, other faces get pasted over. She looks up from her notes and is suddenly speaking as though directly to Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: You'll have your privacy back, Sonny. Your... self. I wish... (she clears her throat) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE
dialogues.text: I wish I were around to see you smile at... not being recognized. I wish I were around... just to make a little trouble. She searches for the right words;

dialogues.speaker: . HALLIE
dialogues.text: There's no place I'll ever be that I won't... for just one moment... see with your eyes. The way I saw those beautiful high places, thac canyon without a name, where Rising Star's run- ming now. And... and the way you showed me... me. (she pauses) I envy the people you talked to this morning, somewhere down the road. Where was it? Some... some dusty cafe where they serve candle- lit donuts? I... I miss you cowboy and hope to see you again one day. For now... forever... wherever you are; good luck, Sonny. I hope this finds you... well.

dialogues.speaker: A STRETCH OF HIGHWAY IN THE SOUTHWEST
dialogues.text: The highway rolls as far as the eye can see, toward distant hills. It's deserted except for Sonny. He moves along the road, a duffel bag over his shoulder. The shadows are long indicating nightfall is not far off.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (continuing) This is Hallie Martin in New York saying Goodnight. CAMERA BEGINS A SLOW PULL AWAY, UNTIL Sonny is a tiny speck, lost in the rolling countryside. THE END.
